thread.title: Jimmy Kimmel Trolls Trump on Twitter, Brings “Mean Tweets” to Oscars | Vanity Fair
thread.title_full: Jimmy Kimmel Trolls Trump on Twitter, Brings “Mean Tweets” to Oscars | Vanity Fair

author: Laura Bradley
title: Jimmy Kimmel Trolls Trump on Twitter, Brings “Mean Tweets” to Oscars | Vanity Fair
text:
Oscars 2017 Best-Dressed Celebrities: See the Head-Turning Looks Ruth Negga in Valentino RUTH NEGGA IN VALENTINO 
Negga has been a red carpet stand-out all season long—scoring a Vogue cover along the way—and at the Oscars she opted for a somewhat daring red almost Gothic-sque look that we are very much digging. Photo: By Rob Latour/REX/Shutterstock EMMA STONE IN GIVENCHY 
This is the kind of dress you wear when you know you’re going to win an Oscar. Photo: By Steve Granitz/Getty Images. KARLIE KLOSS IN STELLA MCCARTNEY 
Kloss is giving us extreme “Gwyneth Paltrow Tom Ford Oscar Dress” flashbacks here, and it is working. Photo: By Jeff Kravitz/Getty Images. TARAJI P. HENSON IN ALBERTA FERRETTI 
The sheer force of this look is enough to give us the energy and inspiration to get through what is sure to be a very long night. Photo: By Steve Granitz/Getty Images. SCARLETT JOHANSSON IN ALAÏA 
This is a more floral and feminine ScarJo look than we are used to from her, and the gown, in tandem with the striking hair, combines for a very powerful effect. Photo: By Kevin Mazur/Getty Images. Charlize Theron in Dior CHARLIZE THERON IN DIOR 
Theron’s hair is similar to Scarlett Johansson’s (and their dresses have a kind of similar cut) and if we don’t get a picture of the two of them together by the end of the night, we will be very disappointed. Photo: By Frazer Harrison/Getty Images. JANELLE MONAE IN ELIE SAAB 
This entire look belongs in an art museum. Hell, a whole museum should be created just to help honor and pay tribute to this look. Photo: By Steve Granitz/Getty Images. Previous
